item.title: Locust birds
item.summary: Locust birds not to be molested; etc. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-31. 8763-8765, 8763 rev. and 8764 rev.). |han≠kass'o's grandfather ordered him not to throw stones at the locust birds, for if he did the locusts (and the locust birds) would disappear.
item.comments: 1) p.8764v: people's arms become sore from throwing stones at swallows and locust birds; Tsatsi was not 'patient', 2) See also Throwing stones at locusts and The locust bird or ||kerri, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-31
